definition: to answer the door
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men

sentences.english: The boy rapped on my door and,without waiting for an answer,breezed into the room.
sentences.chinese: 男孩敲門，還沒等應門就匆匆進入了房間。

sentences.english: What if his wife answers and goes into a fight of jealous rage?
sentences.chinese: 假如應門地是他太太，還大喫飛醋呢？

sentences.english: My father, John, rushes out of the room to answer the door.
sentences.chinese: 我的父親，約翰，從房間衝出來應門。

sentences.english: They left a boy to answer the bell.
sentences.chinese: 他們留下一個孩子應門。

sentences.english: Nobody answered, so she pushed the door open.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人應門，所以她推開門。

sentences.english: The young person who answered the rectory door said that it was “the woman who said she left all the notes.
sentences.chinese: 幫我應門的年輕人說“是個女人，說留言是她放的。”

sentences.english: The salesman rings the doorbell but nobody answers.
sentences.chinese: 推銷員按了一下門鈴，沒有人應門。

sentences.english: But when Noel goes to answer the door, he actually starts pulling off the first one.
sentences.chinese: 但當Noel去應門時，他卻開始把貼紙往下拉。

sentences.english: A pale man answered the door.
sentences.chinese: 應門的是一個皮膚很白的男人。
應門的是亞歷克西斯，第三名刺客。

sentences.english: So when her husband knocks on the door, she answers it, naked.
sentences.chinese: 於是，當她老公敲門時，她也光着身子去應門。

sentences.english: I knocked at the door three times but nobody answered.
sentences.chinese: 我敲了三下門但沒人應門。

sentences.english: The life work within the pro, strong nearly five feet without the boy answered.
sentences.chinese: 外無期功強近之親，內無應門五尺之童。

sentences.english: The automatic inductive door driven by linear electric motor takes the linear electric motor as the drive device of the automatic inductive door.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型採用直線電機作爲自動感應門的驅動裝置。

sentences.english: But there was no answer when they knocked at the door.
sentences.chinese: 但是當警察敲門的時候沒有人來應門。

sentences.english: I rang the doorbell but no one answered.
sentences.chinese: 我按了門鈴但沒人應門。

definition: to inquire into/to ask after
to hang oneself
to set a trap
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
unusual condition/something odd/strange shape
calm and composed (idiom)
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
lady's chamber
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
frequently/often/usually/regularly
